step1.heading: Location & Application Context
step1.applyingForTooltip: Select "Adjustment of Status" if applying inside the U.S. Select "Consular Processing" if applying for a visa abroad.

step2.heading: Unlawful Presence Analysis
step2.tooltip: Unlawful presence accumulates when you stay in the U.S. without a valid visa or after your authorized stay has expired.
step2.overstayQuestion: Have you ever overstayed a visa or authorized stay?
step2.departedQuestion: Did you depart the U.S. after this unlawful presence?

step3.heading: Removal & Deportation
step3.tooltip: Deportation orders create a permanent bar. Expedited removal at the border is a 5-year bar. These trigger the need for I-212 consent.
step3.activeRemovalOrder: Is there an active removal order?

step4.heading: Fraud or Misrepresentation
step4.subtitle: Please answer honestly. This is for screening only.

step5.heading: Criminal History
step5.arrestQuestion: Have you ever been arrested or convicted?

step6.heading: Qualifying Relatives & Hardship
step6.tooltip: Extreme hardship to a U.S. citizen or LPR spouse/parent is often required for waivers. Children usually don't count for the "Extreme Hardship" standard but matter for the case.
step6.relativesQuestion: Do you have any of these U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident relatives?
step6.hardshipLabel: Check any potential hardship factors that apply to them:

step7.heading: Screening Results
step7.disclaimer: LEGAL DISCLAIMER: This screening is informational only and does not constitute legal advice. Final eligibility must be determined by a licensed immigration attorney.
step7.priorityReviewDesc: Complex factors detected (Fraud/Removal/Criminal) that require specialized analysis.

alerts.saved: Results saved to client profile. (Data logged to console for validation)
